Instruction: Soak the dates in boiling water in a small bowl and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the cooled date mixture and vanilla.

In a bowl, cream together 1/4 cup of butter or margarine with white sugar; incorporate the egg and vanilla. Gradually add the flour mixture and date mixture in alternate portions, starting and finishing with the dry ingredients. Pour the batter into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan.
Let cool in the pan for about 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Combine coconut, brown sugar, 6 tablespoons of butter, and cream in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and cook for three minutes. Pour over the warm cake and place under the broiler to brown.
